page.title: 11Farming - Spring to Winter
page.content: Almost our entire year to years work is centred on our dairy herd. Owing to recently introduced milk quotas imposed by the E.E.C., we have had to cut our herd from 55 to 47 milking cows. Whereas before we only raised heiffer calves as replacement stock, we now rear some bull calves for the beef market to make up the loss of income from milk. My day begins at 4.45a.m. and starts with a cup of tea whilst I listen to the news headlines on the radio. My first task is to gather the cows from pasture and fetch them to the parlour helped by my dogs Roy, a 9 year old and Lassie who is just a pup. I also check the young stock in the top fields at this time to make sure they are alright. By 6a.m. the cows are positioned in their stalls ready to begin milking.
